page.title: 10 Warnborough - Boars Hill
page.content:
Warnborough College was founded in 1973 as an independent British University College. It is a recognised examination centre for British and American examining bodies. "Warnborough offers a new kind of educational bridge into self awareness, self assurance and a deeper understanding of the world - a passport indeed into the international community"- College brochure.
The college was the palace of the Bishop of Oxford from 1937 to 1953 and then became known as Plater College. Warnborough acquired the campus in 1976 and in 1978 added the adjoining property known then as Yatscombe.
